The internal energy at state A is calculated as U_A = n × R × T = 0.4 × 0.0821 × 127.
The internal energy at state A is U_A = 8.9 × 10^-2 J.
To determine the temperature at state C, the ideal gas law P_C = nRT_C/V_C is used.

The internal energy at state C is calculated as U_C = n × R × T_C = 0.4 × 0.0821 × 121.8.
The internal energy at state C is U_C = 3.04 × 10^-2 J.
